data.title: Fabulous find!
data.text:
My husband and I enjoyed a 5 star pizza and salads on our date night. The salad - beets and goat cheese - was the best I have ever had. I loved their Autumn Sangria - and was caught off guard by its robust flavor and deliciousness.
Staff was friendly and very available.
We are thrilled with this find in our new hometown.  AND they have a Sunday Brunch - sounds like a date!

data.title: Good pizza!
data.text: Visited for the first time and although the wait seemed a bit long for pizza, it was delicious! Nice atmosphere, great service!

data.title: Great place to celebrate!
data.text: Went to Origins to celebrate my friend's 30th birthday and it was perfect! Great drink selection, excellent tapas and pizza. Friendly service was timely and catered to our needs. One plate was cold by the time the rest of our party's were ready, but they were expedient in getting a replacement dish made and were very courteous.

data.title: Owner continues not to listen...
data.text: Look... there's only so much one person can do, right? Let's be clear. I love their pizza. I love their wine selection. They do delicious if you follow the menu. HOWEVER, the service here continues to have issues...and the Brunch on Sunday? Don't bother. It makes me sad, because Hubs and I live downtown and like to spend our money here. The last time we went we waited SO LONG for someone to notice us - this after mentioning to a worker who was more concerned with everything except the four of us standing there - no one else around. Their brunch doesn't make sense. It isn't their food... it's like the not-even-best of Costco warmed up. Again, if you want great, unique pizza this is your buddy, your pal. You will have to endure waiters that run their fingers through their hair and then insist on touching your food. Waiters that visibly goof off when you would just simply like your water filled. So.. go here... have some wine... have some  patience along with your pizza...your taste buds will thank you.

owner_response.author: Jeffrey N, Owner at Origins Wine Bar & Wood Fired Pizza, responded to this review
owner_response.text: First, thank you for your business.  Second, thank you for your constructive criticism.  I will always listen to customer comments and address them appropriately.  As for brunch, I am all ears for getting your feedback to improve our brunch.  We continue to find ways to balance food quality and value to the customer.  As for service, I strive provide top notch service and based on your experience we are falling short of your and my expectations. You should always be greeted promptly and with a smile.  I have addressed these issues with our staff.  I hope you will consider dining with us in the near future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Bright Spot on 5th and Lincoln
data.text: Some friends and us decided to have a drink but stayed for a couple of wood-fired pizzas. There is a large wine menu and many wines sold by the glass. Price per glass seemed a little high but the wines were delicious. We ordered a Bernini pizza of sausage and onion which was good but we liked the Michangelo better with mascarpone, roasted garlic, romano cheese and blessed with a crown of fresh arugula. The crust was a little too rolled at the edges for my taste. When that happens, I just cut it off and leave it on the plate. Nevertheless the Michangelo was a great choice. Nice atmosphere and an enthusiastic waitress.

data.title: Must return again
data.text:
This place looked great inside. Wonderful art & colors that made you sit up and notice. I must return again to this establishment and try the pizza. I've heard it was great however I chose to have the lunch special (1/2 sandwich/1/2 soup).
The 1/2 smoked turkey panini was tasty but the soup of the day (butternut squash bisque) was missing flavor. Maybe it needed more spice to give it a kick but it certainly needed salt, pepper, grated cheese -- Since I love soup I was really disappointed.a
So, next time I try the salad and pizza.

data.title: Another Great Loveland Eatery
data.text: Finally made it into Origins after hearing a lot of good buzz. Definitely a more upscale pizzeria; awesome Italian wood pizza oven, great wine selection, and other gourmet apps and salads. Was there with friends, but noticed that there are quite a few gluten free options which means I can go back with hubby. Another tasty hot spot in downtown Loveland!

data.title: Like Italy only close to home
data.text: Authentic wood fired pizza with a glass of wine and great service made for a wonderful evening. I recommend this restaurant and will return.

data.title: Best Thursday night in Town.
data.text: Thursday night buffet was excellent,food was so tasty and chef will serve special dish to your table Staffs are very friendly and attentive my favourite place foe weekend dinner.

data.title: Great place
data.text:
Very good food. Maybe a little pricier than other places, but worth every penny. Very friendly staff.
This is a great date place!

data.title: I was a little underwhelmed and slightly disappointed
data.text: Atmosphere looks great, but it's cold and loud and it wasn't even busy. One of the appetizers was burned (bread) and the whole artichoke was cold and the $3 add on dip was pasty and flavorless. Service was slow. Maybe it was because it was a Monday night? The wine was terrific... You can get a flight of some of 3 of their best wines for $10. I probably won't go back, and that's sad because I've really looked forward to going to this place.

data.title: Wow!  Everything was great!
data.text: Went on a Monday night and were seated immediately. I had the roasted tomato bisque and it was awesome. Also had the bruschetta (fig and date) and it was also awesome!  Ok same goes for the pizza,my husband says best he's ever had.  The server was very attentive the wine was very good. Definitely would go back. A little expensive but great quality.

data.title: Pleasant Surprise
data.text:
Nice decor and atmosphere. Food was delicious. Huby other a pastrami sandwich that was the best I've tasted ever.
I had a delicious salad. Service was friendly and good. Definitely a place we'll return to.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: A little pricey for pizza but it's not Pizza Hut pizza.  It's good!  This place may not be for everyone, but I will be back.

data.title: One of My Favorites in Loveland
data.text:
Origins is one of my favorite night out destinations in Loveland.  We always get a cheese and meat platter (you can choose French, Italian or Spanish).  They never skimp on the amount of meet and cheese.  They even have gluten free crackers for me.
My husband has sampled some of the sandwiches and loves them all -- I cannot since they don't have a gluten free bread option (hint hint).  There fire oven pizza is fabulous and their gluten free crust is the BEST I have ever had!!!!!!!  It is obviously  made fresh in the restaurant and not something frozen from a restaurant supply which is so often the case with gluten free.  

The bar is beautiful and offers a wonderful selection of wines, beer and signature cocktails.  

Highly recommend for a date night or outing with friends.  Make a reservation if possible, because they are ALWAYS busy.

data.title: Intimate Bistro and Watering Hole
data.text: Cozy loft style bistro with attentive service and great food, including some small plate offerings. Each of us (4 total) had different offerings and everything was well made and prestned nicely

data.title: Amazing pizza
data.text: Huge selection of wines.  The pizza is delicious, I always get the Michaelangelo pizza.  Get there early to order the artichoke appetizer since they run out fast!

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: Delicious pizza with other small plate offerings and beverages make this a go to spot for a wonderful meal.

data.title: Refreshingly Different
data.text: Unique and Delicious. Tastes authentically fresh and definitely makes your taste buds pop! Backroom for dining parties is secluded and charming. A must try. Service doesn't knock your socks off by any means but its on par. This is a place you go for the food and a different take on pizza! Absolutely every bruschetta they have is so good (and I don't even like bruschetta)

data.title: Pleasant Surprise
data.text: Stopped with husband and adult daughter, while spending a partial day in Loveland.  Very pleasant atmosphere.  My daughter and I ordered off the Brunch menu, and got the breakfast pizza, plus the strawberry salad to share, that we enjoyed very much.  Hubby got Reuben Panini, that he said was very good and he would get again.
